item.name: TESTNODE01 Backup plan Completion Result
item.description:
Grab the backup plan completion result. E.g.
CompletionResult: ok
other values include error which the triggers use.

item.name: TESTNODE01 Backup plan Finish time epoch
item.description:
Grab the backup plan finsih time epoch . E.g.
Job Finish time : 872074982
In this case, using the time Skynet becomes slef aware as an example. This is used by the trigger to ensure the last reported backup time is < 24hrs ago

step.params:
plan name: Back up TESTNODE to TESTSERVER
.*
.*
.*
Job Finish stamp: (.*)\.[0-9]+ \1

item.name: TESTNODE01 Backup plan Finish time
item.description:
Grab the backup plan finsih time. E.g.
Job Finish time : 1997-08-20T11:03:02Z
In this case, using the time Skynet becomes slef aware as an example

step.params:
plan name: Backup TESTNODE01 to BACKUPSERVER01
.*
.*
.*Job Finish time\s*:\s*(.*) \1

item.name: TESTNODE01 Backup plan Start time
item.description:
Grab the backup plan start time. E.g.
Job Finish time : 1997-08-20T11:03:02Z
In this case, using the time Skynet becomes slef aware as an example

step.params: plan name: Backup TESTNODE01 to BACKUPSERVER01\nJob Start time\s*:\s*(.*) \1

item.name: TESTNODE01 Backup plan Name
item.description:
Grab the backup plan name for the output. E.g.
Backup plan name: Backup TESTVM to TESTNASLAX01

item.name: linux-headers-generic package
item.description:
Linux generic kernel headers package needs to be installed by Linux agents to compile kernel moduels. Cheat a little by querying metapackage linux=-headers-generic which is always the latest build.
This avoids all sorts of awk and sed clutter to be avoided.

item.name: linux-image-generic package
item.description:
Linux generic kernel package needs to be installed by Linux agents to compile kernel moduels. Cheat a little by querying metapackage linux=-headers-generic which is always the latest build.
This avoids all sorts of awk and sed clutter to be avoided.

item.name: python3-dateutil package
item.description: python3-dateutil is used by the Acronis python script to list backup jobs in command lien format

item.name: Backup Jobs Status
item.description:
uses python script to draw in last X period (can be changed via script) of backup jobs status. Foudn at https://forum.acronis.com/comment/422777
Macro {$LOGPERIOD} defaults to 24 (hrs) but can be set on a per node basis as required. Currently, the -n nodename does nothing.

item.name: acronis_info.py checksum
item.description: Acronis script for listing events info. Get the checksum so version deployed can be checked.

item.name: gcc package
item.description: GCC needs to be installed by Linux agents, in order to compile the DKMS modules.

item.name: make package
item.description: make binary needs to be installed by Linux agents to allow Acronis DKMS kernel modules to be compiled.

item.name: perl package
item.description: Perl needs to be installed by Linux agents as part of the install process

item.name: rpm package
item.description: RPM binary needs to be installed by Linux agents irrespective of base OS. This is used by Acronis installer to deploy the agent/management server

item.name: acronis_info.py script
item.description: Acronis script for listing events info.

item.name: python3-dateutil package
item.description: python3-dateutil is used by acronis_info.py and therefore needs to be installed.

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no /usr/local/bin/acronis_info.py script installed
trigger.description: Alert if /usr/local/bin/acronis_info.py is not deployed as this is needed to list Acronis job info.

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no gcc package installed
trigger.description: Alert if gcc is not installed on Linux box as this is needed to compile kernel moduels for Acronis

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no linux-headers-generic package installed
trigger.description: Alert if linux-headers-generic is not installed on Linux box as this is needed to compile kernel moduels for Acronis

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no linux-image-generic package installed
trigger.description: Alert if linux-image-generic is not installed on Linux box as this is needed to compile kernel moduels for Acronis

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no make package installed
trigger.description: Alert if make is not installed on Linux box as this is needed to compile kernel moduels for Acronis

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no perl package installed
trigger.description: Alert if perl is not installed on Linux box as this is needed to compile kernel moduels for Acronis

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no python3-dateutil package installed
trigger.description: Alert if python3-dateutil is not installed on Linux box as this is needed to list out Acronis jobs

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no python3-dateutil package installed
trigger.description: Alert if python3-dateutil is not installed

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no rpm package installed
trigger.description: Alert if rpm is not installed on Linux box as this is needed to compile kernel moduels for Acronis

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has the wrong /usr/local/bin/acronis_info.py script installed
trigger.description: Alert if /usr/local/bin/acronis_info.py has the wrong checksum, the version is wrong

trigger.name: No Acronis Job data received for more than 60 minutes
trigger.description: If no data is returned for more than 60 minutes, the status of backup jobs cannot be determined.

trigger.name: TESTNODE01 completion result was {ITEM.LASTVALUE} rather than ok
trigger.description:
if the returned status is not "ok" then something went wrong with the backup so alert to this.
Possible values are: ok | error

trigger.name: TESTNODE01 Last Backup Result was more than 24hrs ago
trigger.description: Confirm that the last job result completion time is also within the last 24hrs.

trigger.name: TESTNODE01 no backup result for 24hrs
trigger.description: If there has been no data for 24hrs then we cannot verify the backup status. also a generic catch all for jobs which may be named wrong.
